intro: Teijsmanniodendron subspicatum var. acutifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved teijsmanniodendron, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically acute at the tips. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its small, white flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, round fruits. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
